intro: Treculia lamiana, commonly known as the African shea tree, is a deciduous tree native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the Sapotaceae family and is characterized by its thick, rugged bark and large, compound leaves. The tree produces small, greenish-yellow flowers followed by edible, starchy fruits that are used in local cuisines. Its latex is also utilized in traditional medicine and as a natural adhesive. Treculia lamiana plays an important ecological role in its native habitat, providing food and shelter for various wildlife species.
